intro: Phyllanthus decipiens var. antisihanakensis, commonly known as the Antisihana phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, particularly in the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers, which are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
